content.question: The irony of the description of Nightmare Abbey in the first sentence (“Nightmare . . . Esquire”) derives mainly from the narrator’s

choices.label: informal characterization of the mansion and formal introduction of Christopher Glowry, Esquire
positive depiction of the mansion and hints that the mansion is actually poorly situated and in disrepair
seemingly objective remarks about the mansion and biased perspective toward Christopher Glowry, Esquire
assertion of the dignity of the mansion and the lack of respect accorded to Christopher Glowry, Esquire

content.answer: positive depiction of the mansion and hints that the mansion is actually poorly situated and in disrepair

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
